question: You are 4 minutes and 30 seconds late for your tee time in competition against a player from Kedleston.*

choices.text: If you are up to 5 minutes late you will get 2 penalty strokes.
Its a good job you were not over 5 minutes late because you would have been disqualified!
It's ok, you are allowed to be a little late.
If you opponent already gone you will need to catch them up.

explanation: If a player is not ready to play at their tee-off time, they usually incur a penalty of 2 strokes for being up to 5 minutes late. More than 5 minutes late usually gets you disqualified.
